page.title: 05PRIMARY SCHOOL, SPARSHOLT.
page.content: Sparsholt School has sixty four pupils,they come from Sparsholt, Littleton,Crawley and Weeke. The main building was built in 1876, it is made of flint,wood and bricks.It has a lobby,library and television area.There are two temporary huts,in one the infants and lower juniors have their classrooms and in the other there is the office and top juniors. On the playground there is a climbing frame,a sand pit and some logs.At playtime we play cricket and go on our roller skates.When we arrive at 8:45 the teachers call a register,then the whole school does reading,maths, language,project work,games and P.E. We go on quite a few trips to the College of Agriculture,the Tower Arts Centre,in Winchester,and in the fourth year to Wales or Stubbington for about a week.
